metadata.title: CVE-2018-16866 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An out of bounds read was discovered in systemd-journald in the way itparses log messages that terminate with a colon ':'. A local attacker canuse this flaw to disclose process memory data. Versions from v221 to v239are vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16866` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu21.15
libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu21.15
libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu21.15
libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.15
libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu21.15
libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu21.15
systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.15
systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu21.15
systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu21.15
systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu21.15
systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu21.15
udev - 229-4ubuntu21.15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '229-4ubuntu21.15').
